intro: Cirsium hygrophiloides, commonly known as the water thistle, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the thistle family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist soils and is often found near streams, ponds, and marshes. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional herbal remedies. Cirsium hygrophiloides plays an important role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
